properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected to continue. Locations: southeastern Labrador. Time span: continuing into Friday. Remarks: While most coastal communities will now only receive rain during this event, freezing rain is forecast to continue for higher elevations of the Trans-Labrador Highway. While it is not certain what the impacts of such a long period of icing will be, there is certainly potential for heavy ice build up in some areas after more than 24 hours of freezing rain. Along the coast, 20 to 30 mm of rain is expected by Friday evening. While this is forecast to remain just below rainfall warning criteria, some localized flooding will be possible due to the rain combining with snow melt runoff. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Utility outages may occur. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-08T15:59:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T02:18:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0086462010.2021
Area: Norman Bay to Lodge Bay, Cartwright to Black Tickle, Eagle River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions will continue this morning. Winds will gradually diminish throughout the day leading to improved visibilities, but periods of snow and blowing snow can still be expected until this evening. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T16:59:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T09:35:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1451525303.2021
Area: Resolute
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Additional Snowfall: 5 to 20 cm, highest amounts in the Makkovik area. Maximum wind gusts: northerly 60 km/h. Locations: the mid Labrador coast from Rigolet to Makkovik. Time span: continuing until this evening. Remarks: The snow will combine with strong northerly winds to produce blowing snow, especially over exposed areas. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-09T01:15:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T09:16:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3112105130.2021
Area: Rigolet and vicinity, Postville - Makkovik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong southeasterly winds with gusts in excess of 90 km/h are occurring in Arctic Bay this morning. Along with these winds, visibilities will be reduced at times in blowing snow. These strong winds will diminish this morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T16:02:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T10:41:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2235559917.2021
Area: Arctic Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow combined with strong winds will reduce visibilities to near zero over these areas today. Protect yourself from the wind, the cold and disorientation by staying safely inside. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-09T01:10:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T09:11:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1196749591.2021
Area: Ivujivik, Akulivik, Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Areas of dense fog have developed in the Red River Valley. These areas are expected to persist for most of the night with gradually improving visibilities through the day on Friday. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A strong frontal system approaching the BC coast is bringing very strong southeasterly winds to the exposed coastal sections of the North Coast and Haida Gwaii. Southeast winds of 100 to 120 km/h have developed and will ease by midday. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T21:59:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T12:44:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3244839864.2021
Area: Haida Gwaii, North Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow will continue until late this afternoon. Additional Snowfall: 5 to 10 cm. Location: Upper Lake Melville. Remarks: Snow is expected to gradually taper to flurries by late this afternoon. Northerly winds gusting up to 50 km/h may cause reduced visibility in blowing snow over exposed areas at times. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

Area: Upper Lake Melville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Nearly 25 cm of total snowfall accumulations is expected between Pleasant Camp and the Chilkat Pass by early Friday morning. A frontal system will move across the northern Alaskan Panhandle tonight and continue to spread snow to the areas of the Haines Road south of the Chilkat Pass. The heavy snow will ease by early Friday morning as the system moves out of the area. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T13:59:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T01:00:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2435131348.2021
Area: Haines Road - Haines Junction to Pleasant Camp
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A strong frontal system currently along the BC coast is bringing very strong winds to the exposed coastal sections of the Central Coast. Southeast winds of 90 to 110 km/h will ease by mid morning. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blowing snow is continuing until this evening. Locations: Hopedale and vicinity. Time span: continuing until this evening. Remarks: Strong northerly winds gusting between 70 and 80 km/h will combine with 5 to 10 cm of new snow to produce very poor visibility in blowing snow. Conditions will improve by this evening as the snow begins to taper off and winds begin to diminish. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-09T01:14:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T09:15:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3609430603.2021
Area: Hopedale and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Blizzard conditions are expected tonight in Naujaat as an approaching low pressure system brings snow and very strong southerly winds with gusts up to 70 km/h. Winds are expected to ease overnight bringing improved visibility. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
